info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 8:29AM CDT until June 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Minnesota, including the following counties, Faribault and Freeborn.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. Water over roadways. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 828 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albert Lea, Wells, Clarks Grove, Minnesota Lake, Alden, Glenville, Geneva, Emmons, Bricelyn, Hartland, Freeborn, Mansfield, Easton, Frost, Twin Lakes, Conger, Kiester, Brush Creek, Walters and Manchester.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING
